entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: do you travel a lot

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: so that is a full time job h

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: do you travel a lot

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: somewhat we can we went to israel about two months ago for a pilgriage with our church yeah so i would say yes i have traveled a bit

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: i would love to hear about one of your trips

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: well most recently we like two months ago went to israel for a pilgriage we were gone about nine days and it was fabulous it was we spent the first five days in chorazine which is near the galilee and in a place called i mean the the name of the area is chorazine but we stayed in a place called adonis galilea which is a a house for that welcomes christian pilgrims as well as jewish pilgrims

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: that is so good to hear what do you enjoy about traveling

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i i enjoy like really the most important thing i enjoy is like meeting the people and and of course seeing the the history i mean especially israel i mean it is the it is totally ancient but most most i enjoy is is the the people i think to get a better understanding of how different cultures live

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: okay do you consider yourself an introvert

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: no not at all

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: why

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: just do not i you know all my life i have always been open and and willing to socialize and i remember my younger brother always joking and saying that i i would talk to anybody and i will i will talk to just about anybody just because i enjoy learning about other people

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: that is good what do you do to relax

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: most of the time like by the end of the day after i have cooked dinner and we have had dinner together as a family i there is a word game on the computer that i like to play for a little while and then watch tv have a cocktail with my husband and just relax that is what we do and you know cause we have a lot going on we do not stay up too late so i like to watch crime dramas

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: nice what are some things that make you really mad

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: really mad probably not a lot i get frustrated with for example my daughter does not clean up her room almost ever so that that gets me angry but in terms of like really getting like heatedly angry i mean other than like little things that my children do to you know especially my oldest child who is twenty one you know he can be confrontational so other than that nothing gets me like really angry have not i have not have not felt that

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: okay what is the best thing about being a parent

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: contributing to society helping helping to raise responsible people i guess and of course the love and the affection and the the fun and the excitement that goes with it of all the stages that go i mean like really right now i am in a stage where my children are either adults or teenagers i only have i have one eleven year old and the rest are all teenagers and adults so it is really fun because we are able to talk about current events and all kinds of stuff that is going on in the world and you know have have challenging discussions and that sort of thing so it is it is a different level than when you are taking care of babies and you know changing diapers and that kind of stuff

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: h what is the hardest thing about being a parent

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: the hardest thing is that it is twenty four seven you are never not a parent you know it is and so you have to accept that and that is i remember when i first with my first child thinking you know when i brought him home from the hospital this is it i mean there is no going back you you cannot change i mean i guess you could if you did something horrible but i mean under normal circstances you can not change that and it is a permanent thing and it it it in some ways it takes away your freedom but in other ways it give you a different sort of freedom

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: who is someone that is been a positive influence in your life

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i am sorry i did not get what you said

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: what are some things you like to do for fun who is someone that is been a positive influence in your life

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: some of the things that have been a positive influence in my life most importantly my church and my faith but also my husband he is been a really he is kind of he is very like logical thinking and very you know grounded so when if i get emotional or i get upset about something he is always we balance each other out likewise if he is upset about something i am able to balance him out it is been a that is been a a great gift in my life

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: how are you at controlling your temper

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i do not i i do not think i would be categorized as somebody with a a temper occasionally i i occasionally i get angry but i do not like have like rarely do i have outbursts i am more more likely to you know to say what i feel not let it build up so with you know like my husband and i do not rarely fight like have argents that are yelling and screaming or anything like that it almost never happens because i i like i said i am more of a type of person that counicates on the spot so if i am thinking something i usually counicate it right away instead of letting it build up

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: that is good when was the last time you argued with someone and what was it about

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: usually i am arguing with my older son because he you know he thinks he knows everything he is twenty one years old so he has the know it all mentality and i am just telling him that he does not know it all and you know as life goes on he will learn more he is very confident and very self self what is the word self assured and so he thinks that you know everything he does is correct and he still has a lot of learning to do that is all

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: that sounds really hard

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: it is it can be

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah how would your best friend describe you

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: as loving nurturing funny we laugh a lot and caring honest things that i mean my best i have well actually my best friend is it is two people it is two sisters that i grew up with and we i for some years took care of their mother who has alzheimers before my parents got sick so i had a very close have a very close relationship with them still do and so i am considered the fourth sister so i would say that those are my best friends and and we love each other very much it is a good relationship

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: aw have you ever served in the military

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: no

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: have you ever been diagnosed with ptsd

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: no

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: have you been diagnosed with depression

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: yes most

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: how long ago were you diagnosed

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: mostly minorly depression it was more anxiety probably it is probably been five or six years i mean i have had if off and on all my life but it was never diagnosed originally like as a teenager i think is when i first had started with the anxiety but

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: other than that i i you know so depression kind of goes with anxiety if it is not under control but now it is under control so i have a great

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: are they triggered by something

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: h

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: are they triggered by something

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: no i think it was what they call free float free floating anxiety more of a of of organic reason for it in other words there there was a chemical imbalance

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: oh

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: in my brain

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: how have you been feeling lately

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i have been feeling pretty good actually the holidays were great we had a good family gatherings a little stressed because we are making a big decision right now to help my parents out my dad is really sick and we have offered to move in with them they have a big home but we would have to do a lot of some renovation and some to help and some obviously moving around and so we are in the throws of that and so that is a big big change but i am looking forward to it because really do not want my parents to be alone as they get they are in their eighties so as they get closer to death i want to have my family there with them

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: i understand how easy is it for you to get a good night is sleep

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: not easy usually all of my life i think i have always i mean i am not i have always had at least i wake up at least once in the middle of the night

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: why

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: to go to the bathroom basically

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: oh

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: and other than that i mean no now i sleep well i mean other than that i sleep well but sometimes if i wake up like really early in the morning then i can not go back to sleep i will get up and maybe do some work on the computer and then go back to bed and go back to sleep idepends on what my schedule is and if the kids are have to be at the school early and there is a lot of factors

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: that sucks

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: yeah sometimes it does

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: what are you like when you do not sleep well

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: probably basically the same i think i might complain a bit like oh i am tired or my body hurts or whatever you know but i think overall probably the same my kids know i will be i will tell me kids oh i am really tired and they will understand my older daughter will be really helpful

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: okay

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: they my other daughter will try to cook dinner or something like that so you know they may pitch in a little bit more

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: h have you noticed any changes in your behavior or thoughts lately

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: not really not not no not really not anything significant

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: do you feel like therapy is useful

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: h

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: do you feel like therapy is useful

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: actually yes i do i do feel like therapy is useful

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: tell me more about that

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: well we had a situation with my daughter she also suffers from anxiety and we have had her in therapy for some time and we just recently we are about to finish a group with her that was a six month group for dbt it is called and it is like a it is the first time they it is the first time they are docenting using it with teenagers and it is been really good it is been very helpful it is just all about how to live in the moment and how to you know actual physical and mental strategies to keep your keep you from your mind from going crazy you know worrying about things or you know in this case some of the kids have tried to harm themselves or whatever so that is the focus of the therapy and it is been really good my husband and i both have been going with our daughter and it is been really really informational and really helpful i think

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: that is so good to hear what got you to seek help

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: oh my daughter was she was in a bad way she was you know suffering a lot and we knew it and we acted on it that is all

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: that is great when was the last time you felt really happy

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: like really joyful and happy i would say probably when probably it would be in israel when we renewed our marriage vows in the the at the in knaan

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: aw

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: so you know where the wedding of kana took place that was really moving and beautiful and it was it happened that our anniversary was we left on our anniversary day flew to israel so it was right at the same time it was beautiful

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: is there anything you regret

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i with my third child i had kind of a crazy nurse she was a little psychotic but other than that we laugh about it now but when i was in labor it was not funny

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: and she she was not there when the doctor i mean it was my my third child was born very quickly after he broke the water and oof my husband was there but she was not nor was the doctor and she got in a lot of trouble because i only had like two contractions after that

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: oh no

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: my daughter was born in the bed so for me it was great cause i did not have to go through any of the labor but i am sure they were not happy to fill out a lot of paper work after that

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: so

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: what advice would you give yourself ten or twenty years ago

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: now would i give mysef for ten or twenty years ago ten or twenty years ago i was probably more not as relaxed not as like i feel now at my age that i i do not have the same concerns that i did then i do not worry about i do not worry at all about what people think about me i do not worry at all about what you know you know like my i noticed my daughter is oh mom you can not wear that because people are gonna say this i just say i do not care you know but they do because it is still in their frame of mind that that oh mom you have to dress like this and dress like that whatever so that would probably be it the wisdom that you you achieve with age that you you see how life there are so many things that are more important in life than worrying about little things
